title: Probate documents and estate proceedings
personalDataVerified: Deceased name, executor name, heirs, court jurisdiction, case number, asset inventory, probate order date, judge name
personalDataVisible: Estate status (open/closed). Link to probate court system (heirs and attorneys, requires authentication)
rationale: Court-issued probate orders require permanent legal records. Domain binding verifies court jurisdiction and prevents forged estate documents. Estate disputes can last decades requiring verifiable records. Human-readable court orders essential for legal proceedings. Prevents fraudulent probate claims and estate fraud. Executors and heirs verify court orders without requiring court backend access.
